- In 1996, most Fender amplifier manufacturing moved to the Ensenada factory in Mexico, where the company also produces acoustic guitars, electric basses, and bass amplifiers.

Advanced Information:
- The first "Fender" amplifiers were manufactured by Leo Fender and Doc Kauffman, doing business as the K&F Manufacturing Corporation, with the early models relying upon vacuum tube circuitry and the company adding solid-state models in the late 1960s.
- In 2001, production of the Hot Rod Series amplifiers, including the Pro Junior and Fender Blues Junior, was moved to the Ensenada factory in Mexico.
